localizedDescriptions.en: Group of individuals connected by social interactions and personal relationships.
An individual human being.
A label for the individual.

annotations.comment: For example: 'Neighbour in the house with the red door'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Discrete components of an individual's name.
One or more honorific form(s) of address commencing a name.

annotations.comment: Occurrences for this data element are set to 0..* to allow for more than one Title to be recorded. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Doctor'; 'Ms'; 'Mx'; or 'Professor Dr'.

localizedDescriptions.en: One or more unique name(s) used to identify an individual within a family group.

annotations.comment: Occurrences for this data element are set to 0..* to allow for more than one Given name to be recorded. In addition, this data element may be cloned and renamed within a template to allow discrete recording of different types of Given name - for example 'First name', 'Middle name', 'Preferred name' or 'Nickname', as required for a specific use case.

localizedDescriptions.en: One or more name(s) that an individual has in common with a family group.

annotations.comment: Also known as 'Last name' or 'Surname'. Occurrences for this data element are set to 0..* to allow for more than one Family name to be recorded. Complex names such as 'El Haddad' or 'van der Heyden' can be recorded using this naming pattern, as identified in ISO 22220 (Annex F), but for the intended use case for this archetype it is most likely that the full family name will be recorded as a string.

localizedDescriptions.en: The relationship or role of the individual to the subject of the health record.

annotations.comment: For example - the copyholder of an advance care record; contact person in an organisation; relative in a family history entry; specimen collector; or witness to a fall or accident. If the individual being described using this archetype is the subject of the health record, then this data element is redundant.

list.label: Wettelijk vertegenwoordiger op grond van ouderlijk gezag

localizedLabels.en: Wettelijk vertegenwoordiger op grond van ouderlijk gezag

localizedDescriptions.en: Details about the location of a person, physical building or landmark.
An unstructured address line representing all relevant street-level or post-box details that would support the identification of a location.

annotations.comment: Occurrences for this data element is set to 0..* to allow one or more free text 'Address line' data elements to represent the huge variety of ways that ‘street-level' details may need to be recorded within the context of a specified 'Town'. Multiple address lines can be represented in a template, renamed as 'Address line 1', 'Address line 2,' etc. For example: '7A/52 Davis Street' or 'Apartment 7A' as Address line 1 with '52 Davis Street' as Address line 2; a roadside mail box location, such as 'RMB 725, Princes Highway'; or using a descriptive landmark, such as or 'Corner of Smith & Brown Streets' or 'Second house north of the general store with the red door'.

localizedDescriptions.en: The name of the lowest level locality that contains the address.

annotations.comment: For example: suburb, town, city, settlement, village, or community. Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Fitzroy'; 'Manchester'; 'Kingston' or 'Bergen'.

localizedDescriptions.en: The name of a local government district or geographical area that contains the address.

annotations.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Surf Coast' and 'Yarra' local government councils in Victoria, Australia;and the Parishes of 'Saint Andrew' and 'Kingston' in Jamaica..

localizedDescriptions.en: The code for a postal delivery area containing the address, as defined by the relevant postal delivery service.

annotations.comment: Also known as a postcode or ZIP code.

localizedDescriptions.en: The name of the country containing the address.

annotations.comment: For example: Australia; Canada; Jamaica; or Norway. Coding with an external terminology, such as EN ISO 3166–1 Alpha 2 country code, is recommended.

list.label: Sint-Helena, Ascension en Tristan da Cunha

localizedLabels.en: Sint-Helena, Ascension en Tristan da Cunha

localizedDescriptions.en: The type of address.
Additional narrative about the address not captured in other fields.
A generic cluster heading for contextual renaming within a template.
Details about a specified type of electronic communication.
The type or form of electronic communication.

annotations.comment: The DV_CODED_TEXT value set supports recording of the most common electronic communications used in health. If other alternatives are required the DV_TEXT data type can be used to record other types of electronic communication such as social media or video conferencing URLs within a template.

localizedDescriptions.en: The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, relevant for representation of 'Type'.

annotations.comment: For example: area code + landline phone/pager number; country code + mobile phone number; or email address.

localizedDescriptions.en: The purpose or use for the identified type of electronic communication.
Additional narrative about the electronic communication not captured in other fields.
Details about a specified type of electronic communication.
The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, relevant for representation of 'Type'.

annotations.comment: For example: area code + landline phone/pager number; country code + mobile phone number; or email address.

localizedDescriptions.en: The purpose or use for the identified type of electronic communication.
Additional narrative about the individual not captured in other fields.
